content.description: Monica’s Restaurant Kitchen, she is frantically working and is handing two finished dishes to a waitress.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, now this one is rare, this one is medium well! Now go-go-go! (Phoebe enters) Hey Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey how was dinner?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Dinner was good!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m just saying hi! Now I’m gonna go!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!
(Phoebe turns to leave but notices an attractive man.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well hello there.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I didn’t see this on the menu.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh Tim? This is Phoebe. Phoebe this is Tim, my new sous chef.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, so you’re Monica’s boss?

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Actually she’s my-my boss. Sous is French for under.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! I sous stand.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Tim? I need a calamari and a Caesar salad. And umm, could you get me the pesto?

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh you…you made pesto?

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Yes I did.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Would you say your pesto is the best-o?

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: I…I-I don’t know, but I would say it’s pretty good-o. (Phoebe laughs too hard.)
(Monica goes over and grabs the pesto.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I still need a calamari and a Caesar salad.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: I like your necklace.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I made it myself.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: You are so talented.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it’s no pesto.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, all right! Let’s just cut to the chase, okay? (To Phoebe) You’re single. (To Tim) You’re single. (To Phoebe) He gets off work at eleven. (To Tim) She’ll be waiting for your call. (To Phoebe) I’ll give him your number if I can get one calamari and one Caesar salad!! (Everyone in the kitchen stops.) I did not yell. I am not putting a dollar in the jar.

content.description: Chandler’s Office, he’s working at his computer as his boss, Mr. Franklin, sticks his head in.

content.speaker: Mr. Franklin
content.text: Wow Bing! Burning the midnight oil.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know me sir. Oh ah, I do have a question for ya. Do you know how I get around the office computer network so I can access the really good Internet porn?

content.speaker: Mr. Franklin
content.text: You’re a joker Bing. (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s funny about that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Sorry I kept you waiting so long.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey that’s okay. So, where do you want to go?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh ah, I think you know where I want to go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The Hard Rock Caf� ?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Again?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!!
(They go out to the elevators.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m telling you, I like the food!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You like the Purple Rain display! (A guy walks up.) Hey Bob.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Hey Toby! Have a good night. (Walks by.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did that guy just call you Toby?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, he thinks that’s my name.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, why don’t you correct him?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh it’s been going on way to long now. Y’know, I mean the first time he said it we were just passing each other in the hallway, so I didn’t say anything. And then the next time he said, “Hey Toby, do you want a donut?” And I-I wanted a donut. And now it’s five years later, the donut’s gone and I’m still Toby.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Five years?! Chandler you have to tell him!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! That would be so awkward! Look—Besides, we work in different departments. He’s on the sixth floor y’know? So he calls me Toby once in a while. What’s the big deal? It could be worse, it’s not like he’s calling me Muriel. (Chandler suddenly freezes into place.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Muriel. Wh-why would he call you Muriel? (Ross realizes something.) Oh my God! Chandler M Bing? It’s not just an M, your middle name is Muriel!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Shh! It is a family name!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler Muriel Bing. Boy, your parents never gave you a chance did they?

content.description: [Scene: Days Of Our Lives set, Joey is doing a scene with a co-star as Rachel watches on a monitor.]

content.speaker: Joey’s Co-Star
content.text: Drake, I’ve discovered the reason for all your headaches and memory loss.

content.speaker: Dr. Drake Ramoray
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Joey’s Co-Star
content.text: Apparently your brain transplant was not entirely successful. It seems your body is rejecting Jessica’s brain.

content.speaker: Dr. Drake Ramoray
content.text: Is it serious?

content.speaker: Joey’s Co-Star
content.text: Not if we extract tissue from the original host body, synthesize antibodies, and introduce them into your system, which could stop it from rejecting the brain.

content.speaker: Dr. Drake Ramoray
content.text: Well that sounds simple enough, let’s just do that.

content.speaker: Joey’s Co-Star
content.text: We would, but when we went to exhume Jessica’s body, it was gone.
(Dramatic music plays and Joey does a little ‘Smell-the-fart’ acting.)

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Cut! Very nice people!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, let me just get changed and we can go to dinner.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well don’t—What happened to Jessica’s body?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m not telling, you’ll have to see it on TV!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You don’t know do you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, couldn’t care less.

content.speaker: Joey’s Co-Star
content.text: Hey good scene man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey you too!

content.speaker: Joey’s Co-Star
content.text: Alright.
(Rachel clears her throat.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? You weren’t in it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! (Motions to Joey’s co-star.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh sorry. Uh-uh, Kash?

content.speaker: Kash
content.text: Yes?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is my friend Rachel. Rachel, Kash, Kash, Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Kash
content.text: Hey! How come I haven’t seen you here before?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, Joey probably thinks I’ll just embarrass him. Y’know, he thinks I’m some kind of a soap opera nut—Which I’m not! I’m not. Although I do know that your uh, your favorite ice cream flavor is butter pecan. (Starts stroking his arm) And uh, and that your-your dog’s name is Wally. Well look at that, I’m just stroking your arm.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here we go! Here we go! (Starts to pull her away from Kash.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, we’re leaving. Bye Kash.

content.speaker: Kash
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Say hi to Wally.

content.description: Central Perk, Monica is getting coffee as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! I had the best time with Tim last night. He is so sweet! Oh, I can’t wait to get sous-neath him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I…I have to fire him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But why?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because he’s terrible! Okay, he’s slow, he burns things, last night he lit my pastry chef on fire!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well maybe he was just nervous, y’know you can be very intimidating. And besides I’ve met your pastry chef and she can stand to be taken down a peg or two.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, now she has no eyebrows, mission accomplished.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But Monica, he loves his job so much! Can you just give him another chance? Please?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, but if-if he lights someone else on fire he is out of there!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s fair! Thank you so much. Thanks. Oops, it looks like when he got the pastry chef he got you a little bit too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I paid to have this done.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Love it!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is eating at the counter as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh you know uh Kash, really liked you the other day. He said he thought you were charming.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I thought I was a complete idiot.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I’m with you. He even asked me if I thought you’d go out with him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Oh, I think I’m gonna throw up a little bit. What did you say?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I said no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? I…I just figured since you’re pregnant you’re not gonna be seeing people.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay Joey, first of all Kash Ford is not people. Second of all, what did he say when you told him I was pregnant?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I didn’t tell him. I didn’t know if you were telling people. This is back when I thought Kash was still people.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good-good, don’t tell him. Don’t tell him. Just have him call me okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach look, I really don’t think that’s such a great…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you go do it! I’ll come back to that set! I’ll meet more actors! I’ll meet ‘em all!

content.description: Chandler’s Office Building, Chandler is walking by the elevators and sees Bob standing there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Bob.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Hey! How’s my pal Toby doing today?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If I see him, I’ll ask.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Toby!
(The elevator doors opens, Bob boards the elevator, Chandler walks away, and Mr. Franklin steps out of the elevator.)

content.speaker: Mr. Franklin
content.text: Hey-hey! Bing? Was that Bob from six you were just talking too?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Mr. Franklin
content.text: Oh then you know each other.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re on a semi-first name basis.

content.speaker: Mr. Franklin
content.text: What do you think of adding him to our team?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bob? Ooh, working here with us? Everyday? Yeah, I don’t know if he has what it takes.

content.speaker: Mr. Franklin
content.text: Really? They love him down on six.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But this is eleven. It’s almost twice as hard up here.

content.speaker: Mr. Franklin
content.text: Okay, I hear you loud and clear. Bob will stay put.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think it’s best sir.

content.speaker: Mr. Franklin
content.text: But we really do need to find someone up here. The work is starting to pile up. I’ve got a stack of documents on my desk this high. (Holds his hand at shoulder level.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what you should do, just toss ‘em in the shedder and claim you never got ‘em.

content.speaker: Mr. Franklin
content.text: That’s a good one. (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What does a guy have to do to be taken seriously around here?!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is in the kitchen as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. Okay, I gave him another chance, but Tim has got to go!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! No-no! He is totally incompetent. I called the chef who recommended him to me. He said, “Ha-ha! Gotcha!”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Okay, but you can’t fire him today.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why not?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because I’m dumping him today.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! You said he was sweet!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He is sweet. He’s too sweet. He calls me all the time. (Mimicking him) “So did-did you get home from work okay?” “Did-did you get out of the shower okay?”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just don’t pick up your phone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then he comes over! (Mimicking him) “I’m so worried about you.” Uck! Be a man!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? So now I’m not allowed to fire him?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You can’t fire him and dump him the same day, he’ll kill himself.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay well then, I’ll fire him today and you go out with him for another week.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you kidding?! Another week with that sip, I’ll kill my self!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay well, then we’ll both do it today and he’ll just have to deal with it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. But the question is who’s gonna go first. ‘Cause whoever goes second is the bitch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on! The boss that fires a guy that’s just been dumped, bitch! And the woman who dumps a guy that’s just been fired, blond bitch!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wanted to do this days ago so I think I should go first.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, that makes sense. (Starts towards the door.) Ugh. But—Screw you I’m going first! (She grabs her purse and runs out.)

content.description: Chandler’s Office Building, Bob is standing at the elevators and sees Chandler walk up.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Hey Toby, you got a sec?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure, what’s up?

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: I just had a meeting, I was actually hoping to get transferred up here, but I just found out its not gonna happen. Apparently somebody thinks I’m not eleventh floor material. Say uh, who the hell is this Chandler?

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is getting ready for her date and Joey is reading a magazine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, what do you think is a better excuse for why I’m not drinking on this date tonight. “Umm, I’m a recovering alcoholic. I’m a Mormon,” or “I got so hammered last night I’m still a little drunk?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!
content.parenthetical: entering with a pizza and beer

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, what do you want to do tonight? There’s a Ukrainian film at the Angelica that’s supposed to be very powerful. Interested?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. No. But I’ll go see a normal person movie with ya.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach? You wanna come?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, I can’t. I got a date.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A date?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Why? Is that weird for you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why no, it’s the opposite of weird. It’s-it’s uh, regular. It’s-it’s uh, it’s mundane. It’s actually uh, a little dull.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s no Ukrainian film.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah—Ooh! Earrings! (Goes into her room.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A date?! She’s-she’s got a date?! With who?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I set her up with this actor on my show.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You set her up?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey what-what were you thinking?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I was thinking that it’d probably be okay because Ross hasn’t gone out with Rachel in five years!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, I’m not worried about her! I’m worried about my baby! Whoever she dates my baby dates! Now-now where is this (makes the quote-marks sign) actor taking them?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! I’m an (does the quote-marks thing as well) actor too! I’m not sure. I think they’re taking the ferry out to some Italian place on Staten Island.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A ferry? My baby is going on a ferry? Do you have any idea how dangerous those are?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are we talking about one of those big boats that carry cars that go like five miles an hour?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why don’t they just jump out of an airplane?! Huh?! That-that’s a fun date! Or burn each other with matches?! That’s fun too! Whew!!
(There’s a knock on the door and Joey answers it.)

content.speaker: Kash
content.text: Hey Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Kash. Uh hey-hey this is Ross. Ross, this is Kash.

content.speaker: Kash
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. I-I hear you’re going on a ferry tonight.

content.speaker: Kash
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A bit of a daredevil are we?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey guys do you think this is too slutty—Hi Kash!

content.speaker: Kash
content.text: Hey Rachel! You ready to go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! All right, I’ll see you guys later.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Have a great time you guys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Kash
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes it is too slutty! (Joey slams the door before Rachel could hear the entire sentence.)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is reading a magazine as Tim enters.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Hi! (And startles her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Oh, I’m so glad you called. I feel like it’s always me calling you. So, what’s up? Is everything okay with Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It will be…in a minute. Listen, Tim you’re a really great guy.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: It’s because I’m with you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aw. (Phoebe gets a bad taste in her mouth when he looks away) I’m just—I’m in a place in my life right now where I…I…
(Tim’s beeper goes off and he answers it.)

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Whoops. Sorry. (Looking at it, like a newscaster) This just in. (Phoebe fake laughs.) Oh, it’s 9-1-1 from the restaurant, that means Monica needs me right away. (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh-oh no she doesn’t! I know what that is. You can stay.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Awww, I’ll miss you too Pheebs. (Starts to leave) And I will be holding you, right here. (Holds his hands over his heart, blows a kiss to Phoebe who catches it, and then leaves and Phoebe throws the kiss back.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey and Ross are having dinner.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what movie do you want to see—And not another one I have to read. Okay? I get enough of that from books.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Books?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, car magazines, cereal boxes, but it’s like enough !

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I tell you what. Why don’t we uh, why don’t we just stay here? Let’s not see a movie, we’ll just hang.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And just wait for Rachel to come back from her date?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, if that’s what you want to do I’m not gonna say no.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude! What is going on?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just…I have to find out how it went.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This guy could be my baby’s stepfather!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They go on one date and you’re worried about them getting married?! He’s not you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just—I-I can’t believe she’s-she’s dating?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well Ross, what did you think she was gonna do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know! I guess I just can’t believe any of this is happening.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s just I always thought when I had another kid it would be different. Now I-I love Ben, but every time I have to drop him off at Carol and Susan’s, it’s like—It breaks my heart a little. I mean I’ve always had this picture of me and my next wife in bed on Sunday and, my kid comes running in and leaps up onto the bed. And we all read the paper together. Y’know? Maybe fight over the science section.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s a nice picture. Maybe you can still have that!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No I can’t. I mean Rachel’s out with some guy. My baby went with her. If anything that picture keeps moving further away.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, can I ask you something? In this, in this picture of you and your wife, is your wife Rachel?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It used to be. Now she doesn’t really have a face. Smokin’ body though.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good call. Yeah. But, the face Ross, the face isn’t Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No but ahh! How much easier would it be if it were?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, but I don’t think that’s what she wants.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it’s not what I want either. I mean I-I can’t force myself to fall in love with her again now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s okay Ross maybe you need a new picture. Okay? It’s not gonna be what you thought, but no matter what there’s gonna be a brand new little baby, your baby. Who cares what the picture looks like?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I tell you what. Let’s you and me go out and have some fun. Huh? Whatever you want. Come on!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We can still catch that Ukrainian film.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I said fun!

content.description: Outside Chandler’s Office, Chandler is just about to go into his office when Bob calls for him from behind.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Hey Toby!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Bobby.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: It’s Bob actually. Hey, you work up here, can you tell me where this Chandler Bing ’s office is?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh yeah. Yeah, it’s (Points down the hall) right, right down there. (When he has Bob looking down the hall, he turns around and knocks his nameplate off of his door.) Right there, yeah. Can I ask you why?

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: I want to talk to that bastard, see what his problem is.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay Bob listen uhh, I’m the reason you didn’t get the job up here.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Toby don’t.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bob!

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Toby! I’m not gonna let you cover for him. Anything you say right now will just get me more upset with Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well that puts me in a difficult position.

content.description: Monica’s Restaurant Kitchen, Monica is waiting for Tim who enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: I got your page, is everything okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh well that depends, how are things with Phoebe?

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Oh it’s great! It’s great! Thank you so much for introducing us!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my pleasure. Okay, I’m afraid I’ve got some bad news. (Phoebe enters.) Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re fired!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m breaking up with you!

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m, I’m breaking up with you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re fired.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry, I’m just—I’m…I’m just not ready for a relationship right now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah and-and I’m sorry too. But, well I just—I like things done a certain way and the chemistry’s just not right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that’s good, the chemistry thing for us too.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Wow! Umm, okay. Umm… (To Phoebe) I-I-I realize I came on a little strong but, it’s only because I think you’re so amazing. (To Monica) And uh, I-I just wanna, I just wanna tell you how much I appreciate you giving me an opportunity here because I—you’re the most talented chef I’ve ever worked for. Anyway… (Starts to leave and Phoebe and Monica trade looks.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Tim wait!

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, I think I spoke too quickly. There-there’s a learning curve with this job and maybe we can try it again.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Thank you so much! ‘Cause I-I know I can do better!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.
(They both look at Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And Tim I just wanna say, good luck here. (Shakes his hand and leaves, which disgusts Monica.)

content.description: A Street, Ross is walking past a newsstand and sees Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, how was the date?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I’m alone and I just bought fifteen dollars worth of candy bars, what do you think?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh. What happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I made the mistake of telling him that I was pregnant.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, he didn’t uh, take it so well?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well better than you, but y’know still not what you want.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He got all weird and sputtery and then he said uh, “Yeah, I hear those hemorrhoids are a bitch.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He sounds swell.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Doesn’t he?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, wanna…wanna a little cheering up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sit down.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
(They sit on some front steps.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Guess whose middle name is Muriel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler M. Bing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah-ha!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God. (Laughs)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry about your date.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh it’s all right. I’m guess I’m just done with the whole dating thing. It’s one more thing in my life that’s suddenly completely different. This is hard.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah I know. (Pause) On the other hand in um, in about seven months you’re gonna have something that you’re gonna love more than any guy you’ve ever gone out with. Just wait. Wait until uh, wait until the first time your baby grabs your finger. You have no idea.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks sweetie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You wanna, you wanna grab some coffee?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, I think I’m gonna go home and eat ten candy bars.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I thought I cheered you up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh you did, there are twenty in here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right. Good night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good night.
(He kisses her on the cheek and heads to Central Perk.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is entering and Mona from the wedding recognizes him.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hey it’s Mona! From the wedding.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh hi!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! Uh…how are you?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I’m good except umm, you still owe me a dance.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh that’s right. Well uh, would you be interested in seeing a Ukrainian film?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh you’re serious. Sure!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great! Well umm…
(Ross continues to talk to her as the camera pans to show Rachel standing in the doorway.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I think I might need one more cup of coffee.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure! Uh, let me get it for ya.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Okay.
(Rachel watches that and slowly backs out to head for home.)

content.description: Chandler’s Office, Bob is ransacking Chandler’s office.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bob. Bob! Bob!!! (He turns around) What the hell are you doing?!

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: I just found out this is Chandler’s office! Come on Toby, give me a hand!
(He thinks about it and decides to join in by turning over a chair and continue ransacking the place.)
